intro: Crantzia capitata, commonly known as the clustered cranesbill, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are arranged in dense, terminal clusters. Crantzia capitata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
